util.runtime.jvm

Class ClassPath

  • java.lang.Object
    • util.runtime.jvm.ClassPath

  • public class ClassPath
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a JVM class path.

    • Method Detail

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Does this class path have any path entries?
        Returns:
        true for yes, false for no.

      • add

        public ClassPath add(java.nio.file.Path... cpEntries)
        Appends the given entries to this class path. This method will preserve the order in which entries are given as well as the order in which they were added; e.g. add(x).add(y, z) will yield a class path of x:y:z. If an entry was already in the class path, this method will not add it again. This is consistent with the way the JVM searches the class path, as a class path of x:y:x is equivalent to x:y. Also, each entry will be normalized before appending; if it turns out to be the empty path, then it will not be appended.
        Parameters:
        cpEntries - the entries to add; they will be added in the given order from left to right.
        Returns:
        itself to facilitate fluent API style.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the argument is null or any of its elements are null.
        See Also:
        toStream(), toString()

      • add

        public ClassPath add(java.util.stream.Stream<java.nio.file.Path> cpEntries)
        Convenience method, same as add(Path...).
        Parameters:
        cpEntries - the entries to add; the stream must be ordered.
        Returns:
        itself to facilitate fluent API style.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the argument is null or any of its elements are null.

      • add

        public ClassPath add(ClassPath cp)
        Appends all the entries in the given class path to this class path. This method will preserve the order in which entries are stored in the given class path. If an entry was already in the class path, this method will not add it again. This is consistent with the way the JVM searches the class path, as a class path of x:y:x is equivalent to x:y.
        Parameters:
        cp - the entries to add.
        Returns:
        itself to facilitate fluent API style.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the argument is null.
        See Also:
        toStream(), toString()

      • toStream

        public java.util.stream.Stream<java.nio.file.Path> toStream()
        Returns:
        the entries in this class path, in the same order in which they were added.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Turns this class path into its JVM string representation where path entries are separated by a Separator. Entries will be output in the same order in which they were added. If this class path only has one entry, that path is returned as a string without any added separator. If this class path is empty, then the empty string is returned.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
